This is a lovely place in a quiet neighborhood; I loved all of the art!
Don't let the bed fool you; when we got there, we thought the bed looked like a futon I used to sleep on in college, but the mattress turned out to be amazingly comfortable - maybe better than my own bed.
Google had a hard time directing us to the place, but Clarence was on the phone with me less than a minute after I contacted him, and he got us to the front door right away.
We'd stay here again the next time we visit Detroit.

review_text: This booking is a MUST for your stay in downtown Detroit. It was within walking distance from tons of restaurants, bars, and attractions! Perfect spot to catch a Red Wings game - the townhouse is literally across the street from the arena. Sam was friendly, responsive and provided quick communication for everything that we needed as things came up and we needed assistance. They were also flexible with our check in and as accommodating as possible. Can’t recommend this place enough. Book this for your next stay and you will not be disappointed!

review_text: Hands-down the absolute best stay in Detroit! It's literally across the street from Little Caesars Arena, talking 500 feet to the entrance. The Q line metro trolly is directly outside, and generally runs the entire city for free. I cannot say enough about the host, super accommodating, fantastic, communication, and all around just a great guy. I've stayed at a lot of Airbnbs and this is the best host I've ever had. The space is immaculate and the added things like family board games and pre-logged in Netflix was a delightful treat. The bedrooms are huge, 75 to 85 inch TV in each one. Master bedroom has a Jacuzzi and a Zero G bed. Second bedroom has a balcony attached to it. Neighborhood is safe and quiet, this really is a diamond and Detroit. You will not be disappointed with your stay.

review_text: This place was everything we expected and more. Much much more. We three ladies took a trip to Detroit to enjoy the arts, and it did not disappoint. There was some concern among our group about safety in the evening and safety of our accommodations. Those worries were put to rest immediately. We all three felt safe. We all three felt like it was Home. This place had everything we could think about, and many things that we didn’t even consider. Host was responsive. Every time we asked about restaurants, suggestions and availability of transportation. The Q line is right there!! in fact, we could have stayed another night and taken the Q line directly to the DIA and other museums that we visited. Perfect location. Perfect house. Hundred percent are going to use this locale again because we didn’t even scratch the surface of all the Detroit has to offer. Five stars definitely recommend!!

name: Julie
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
February 2024
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text:
Very clean and comfortable AirBnB! The attached garage was SO great to have for the cold Detroit weather. It is very narrow but doable.
There is a long set of stairs going up from the garage. We didn’t have much luggage so it wasn’t too big of a deal but making multiple trips would be a solid cardio workout.
The townhouse looked just like the photos. Very clean! The kitchen was well stocked, including water in the fridge, tea & coffee, and snacks.
Both beds were very comfortable! Soft linens and towels. Cosmetically, the downstairs bathroom is a bit more dated than the other rooms but still nice and clean. The TVs in the living room and bedrooms are HUGE! There are also a keyboard and lots of boardgames in the living room.
Excellent location. Very easy to get an Uber. If there was a major event at Little Caesars arena, I would imagine traffic could get intense. We only encountered Disney on Ice crowds and it wasn’t bad.
I would stay again and recommend to friends!

Stayed one night
review_text:
This place was amazing. Last year we stayed in a Hotel to go to the Leafs/Redwings game, we should have stayed at this place, it's literally across the street, couldn't be more convenient. The place was spotless, they thought of everything, right down to some snacks and even epsom salts for the bathtub. The TVs in the living room and each bedroom were absolutely enormous, definitely the most incredible TVs I've ever seen. Host was great, amazing communication, super friendly, very helpful. Check-in couldn't be simpler. The place even had a garage, it was a tight squeeze, but I managed to fit my Ford F-150 in for the night (make sure you know what you're doing before trying that though, so you don't damage the house or your vehicle). The garage was long enough to fit two small cars inside.
We had a great time, comfy beds, lots of room, and lots to do down there. Definitely recommend checking out his place if you stay in Detroit.

review_text: THIS PLACE IS EVERYTHING I COULD HAVE IMAGINED AND MORE! I booked this place ALMOST immediately after viewing the photos. After a bad experience with another host, I had extreme doubt and almost cancelled my stay completely. I decided against that & I’m SO GLAD I did! I had THE MOST peaceful & relaxing time in this home. It’s very close to Downtown. Minutes away from things to do & good food! It was QUIET. You would think you were the only one in the neighborhood, that’s how serene it was. The place was easy to find & PRISTINE CLEAN. It had INCREDIBLE amenities & DID I MENTION THE BATH & SHOWER?! DEFINITELY MY FAVORITE PART ABOUT THIS WHOLE PLACE! You will end up using it EVERY DAY during your trip. The Smart TV had A LOT of options which was refreshing. I have ZERO complaints. The host was very friendly, helpful, and responsive. I’m SERIOUSLY considering booking it again for next year. BOOK THIS PLACE ASAP!!! I almost wish I would’ve stayed longer, I miss it already!

review_text:
We visited Detroit for the first time and couldn’t have picked a better air bnb. The house was beautifully decorated, spacious and felt brand new. Check in was a breeze and the host was very easy to communicate with. The house came equipped with all of the supplies you could need (cleaning, towels, Nespresso).
The area is slightly North of Corktown which is a great area with fun restaurants and bars. The area is transitioning with some empty/vacant lots and run down homes but seems to be getting built up. We took Uber for the most part and was only a 5-10 min trip to get downtown.
Will definitely stay here again!

name: Omari
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
March 2024
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text:
Our stay was great. The property was cute, cozy, and clean. Instructions were easy to follow. Would book again.
A tip for those among you that may not think things through. The deck entrance is a sliding glass door - it has a security bar that must be raised in order to slide the door open. My advice would be not to raise it, rather, place it elsewhere while using the deck … lest you close the door behind you, allowing the security bar to fall into place, and you find yourself locked out of the apartment with no way to enter the property or get down to the ground floor … short of flying. You then may or may not have to phone a friend to come and rescue you. Just my 2 cents.

name: Elise
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
March 2024
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text:
My BF & I booked a 1 night stay at this AirBnb and enjoyed our experience. Christa and David’s instructions were very clear and helpful for both check-in and checking-out progress. The location was easy to find and very accessible to downtown Detroit! Due to a home Pistons game, there were no open spaces to parallel park on the street when we arrived so having the gated parking spot behind the building was very helpful! This space was super cool, clean, and very nicely decorated. It was stocked with everything you could want during travel-they really thought of everything!
A few comments: Although the loft was very private feeling, there happened to be multiple children whom must’ve been staying under us that were extremely loud right at 7AM. It sounded like a literal “heard of elephants” -obviously not the hosts’ fault, the noise just traveled. Also, the bed loft is not for everyone - keep in mind you must be able to climb the ladder and it’s a tight fit up there but was ok for us!

Clean, spacious, beautiful. Loved the little Detroit touches. Host was very responsive to any questions and everything we needed was there (loved the shower and shampoo/conditioner amenities!). The ladder is steep to get up to the loft, and I was initially concerned, but it is very safe and secure and I didn’t have any issues getting up and down. I’m 5”5 and I could stand up in the loft, but just barely, so if you’re tall, just keep in mind that the roof is low up there. Felt safe parking my car in the private lot and we did see security driving around often. Totally an easy walk to restaurants and the arena. So happy to have stayed here! Would definitely come back.

review_text:
Wow! Really loved this place and wish we could have stayed longer!
We stay in Airbnbs all the time and sometimes they can miss the mark, but Christa and David's is exactly the type of gem that keeps us coming back.
Communication was super prompt and everything was so straight forward and easy. Finding the place, parking, and checking in were all a breeze. Everything was clean and functional. The whole place was tastefully furnished and decorated. It was really the perfect combination of looking nice while still being very comfortable.
It was so convenient to have gated parking and be able to walk to the Tigers game at Comerica Park. They also provided local treats like chips and soda. They just really put a lot of thought and care into the place that I really appreciated.
The ladder to the bed in the loft is quite steep, but the bed is large and comfortable. My fiance and I didn't have any issues at all.
10/10 would recommend and would stay again!

We didn't get to use the roof deck, sadly, as the weather was, well freezing and snowing, but it would have been a really nice spot to unwind at another time of year. On top of it all, it is a perfect location from which to get around Detroit. Its super easy to walk or bike to much of the downtown/midtown from its central location, or to have a car and use it as a jumping point. I highly recommend this place!

The location was close to everything downtown, as well as the area nearby with great restaurants, Whole Foods, art museums, and more. The space is really nice, large, and clean. It has everything you could need- a full kitchen, dining area, living room area, roof top deck, bath with tub, iron + board, bluetooth speaker, wifi, etc. And the upstairs sleeping loft was so so cozy. We loved staying here and would absolutely stay here again!

It was noisy for a while at night, but to be expected as it was a major holiday downtown. We would definitely stay here again and recommend anyone who wants a true Detroit experience to stay at Christa & David’s place! Thank you again for being so communicative & accommodating to our needs. Cheers to 2023!

Stayed one night
review_text: This was my first air bnb experience and I’m so glad it was here! Came for a concert at the Little Caesars Arena and wanted a place nearby, and this place is in walkable distance of the arena. Checking in was easy peasy; parking was in a gated space in the back of the home. We were greeted with a classic Faygo rock and rye, which was delicious and apparently really hard to find. The living room had a nice stereo receiver which packed a lot of sound! The rooftop terrace was a real plus! It came with remote controlled lights that came with preset colors which was awesome. And the bed in the loft was amazingly soft. I wished we could’ve stayed another night but this place was booked - and for good reason! If you’re looking for a real cozy and nice Airbnb with great hosts and nearby the arena (or park) definitely book a night (or more) here!

Walking distance to a great vegan restaurant, coffee shops, etc. Christa was responsive to our questions and we felt welcome, cared for and safe. The place is spacious, well decorated and you can tell a lot of thought went into creating a comfortable place to stay. Both the bed in the loft and the pull out sofa bed were quite comfortable. We'd love to come back and recommend it highly.

rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
May 2022
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text:
Christina & David's place is warm, cozy, and cute as a button. Honestly, the nicest AirBnB that I think I have stayed in, to date. the communicated clearly and gave detailed instructions for check-in. the spaces were very comfortable and full of character. The view from the outdoor balcony is amazing!
We were also very pleased to find quality whole bean coffee, grinder, and french press provided. We are big coffee drinkers and fresh pressed coffee is an important part of our mornings, so it was great to be able to have that since it's not economically viable to pack your own coffee, press, kettle, etc when traveling.
The bed was very comfortable and the loft was a pleasant space. The furnace is quite loud when it kicks on, but it did not wake us. The location is close proximity to a lot of restaurants and bars, although we got in quite late so many were closed, bit I would imagine that this would be a great location to easily access many good sights, sounds, and tastes.
5 stars, we will probably return to this AirBnB in the future.

Also, if you're interested in vegan food check out Chili Mustard Onions it's almost next door and their Coney Islands were unbelievable.

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The apartment building itself was very nice. The apartment was lacking amenities (only given one full towel and one bath tiny one for two people), there was no coffee maker or supplies as described, there was an iron but no ironing board, and worse of all the bathroom was a bit dirty. There were bright pink hairs in the shower. Finally, we were not given a building fab so we had to use the back freight elevator and had to knock on the glass door and have the receptionist open the main door for us at night (we asked about this and were not given one still).
To be fair, the host reached out and asked if there were any issues to resolve, and I of course could have said something, so that is my own fault! But only being there for 36 hours, I did not want to have to deal with any people. So take that for what it’s worth.
Finally, there rules are pretty strict (all outlined pretty clearly), but just be aware of an excessive steps to take (like taking a photo of the tv remote on checkout)

The carriage house feels cozy and safe, and outside noise is minimal. Short and easy walk to LCA and surrounding restaurants. The hosts were kind, responsive, and extremely respectful. I will definitely save this as a place to stay in the future.
Thank you for sharing your beautiful home.

name: Max
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
September 2023
,
·
Stayed with a pet
review_text:
Had a great relaxing stay at the Carriage House. The bathroom was as amazing as the pictures & the brick inside was gorgeous. For a couple, the openness of the layout was nice, but if looking to go with others, you’d need to be very comfortable with them. We walked to downtown & it was an easy walk to get morning coffee and donuts!
The only thing that wasn’t described as well were the details of the entrance. You have to go through the large garage door to go in & out of the space. After going through the garage, there is no other door into the living space - the stairs lead up & into the open space, so essentially if someone/something gets into the garage, there is no security keeping them from the apartment area. It’s in an alley, so for a single traveler or someone anxious about safety, unloading the car & going in & out could feel vulnerable.
Just a detail that would be good for that type of traveler to know, otherwise everything was great! We’ll dream about that tub & shower!😍

This is one of my favorite areas in Detroit because there's so much to do within walking distance. And, of course, as everyone else said, the bathroom is amazing. review_text: Flawless. Great location in a historic neighborhood, just a jump off the freeway. Close to everything. Walkable to Whole Foods. Safe. Quiet. Lawn for the dog. Every amenity. Spotlessly clean. Comfortable bed, with fresh and cozy linens. Ample extra linens and bedding in the spacious closet, with all the hangers you could need. Stylish, comfortable decor in an open but very private, thoughtfully organized space. Speedy Wi-Fi, easy streaming TV. Furthermore, Zoe happily answered my many questions about what to expect, so I could plan and prepare as needed. Getting in was so easy, thanks to her check-in instructions. I appreciate the clarity! I definitely hope to make a second visit! Oh and you all already know about the fantastic soaking tub and rain shower bath. Better than the best hotels in town. Shhhhhh

Stayed one night
review_text: Love this property! Great carriage house with modern decor & stunning bathroom design located behind a historic home in a quiet neighborhood. Parking is free in front of the garage entrance to the home down an alley. I usually don’t sleep well in hotels/Airbnbs, but the bed is actually super comfortable with good bedding & pillows, so I slept great! Location is PERFECT, very walkable to many restaurants and shopping locations, conveniently situated between downtown & midtown Detroit, where most everything is. While there, we had great food at Frita Batidos, delicious cake & coffee at For the Love of Sugar, tacos at Bakersfield, and had to stop in for giant potatoes at Potato Place - all in walking distance. We did drive to the water and do the riverwalk, that was the only time we needed to use the car during our visit. Sadly, we ran out of time to use the gorgeous free standing bathtub and will have to come back again to experience it. Can’t wait to visit again!

Stayed a few nights
review_text: The location was very convenient to all Downtown/Midtown/Corktown activities. The unit was much larger than the pictures implied, was clean and free of clutter, and seemed well appointed. We had a very busy schedule so we didn't make much use of the space in the living areas, exterior, or kitchen. Having a private secure garage was amazing, though the keypad to open the gate to enter the driveway was fairly awkward to use and a shorter individual might struggle to reach it while still being able to see and punch in the code. The neighborhood seemed safe and was all newer residential mixed with big historical homes, with new condos being actively built. We did not walk to downtown but it was very close and we would have felt safe doing so. There was some noticeable road noise overnight (most would except in downtown) and from others staying in the building, so it would be a great touch if a portable fan or air purifier was available in the unit for white noise.

review_text:
Excellent spot, situated between Midtown and Downtown. Sadly the Tigers were on the road for our visit so I couldn't take advantage of the fact that Comerica Park is directly across a field from the house.
The secure parking is fantastic, and the house itself is beautiful. Super clean and airy space. Both bathrooms were pristine.
Check-in and check out were perfect, you get a unique lock code for your stay which is re-assuring and handy that you can show at whatever hour and just open up the house for your stay.
If you are a walker, almost everything is in range. 15 minutes from Dowtown, 15 minutes from MOCAD, 25 to DIA, and 20 minutes from Eastern Market. If you drive, obviously even quicker.
Will definitely be staying here again for my next trip to Detroit.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: As beautiful as the pictures are, seeing Sean’s condo in person is even better…..amazing! Whatever you are booking this space for it would be well worth it to plan time into your stay to just hang out here. Super clean and comfortable with a very responsive host. Inside you will enjoy an incredible amount of Detroit information/history and decor. Relics of memorable Detroit buildings can be found throughout and you will enjoy reading about history of the city in the many books provided for you. While you are there you also have various Motown records to enjoy listening to - along with Michigan / Detroit snacks to enjoy. If by chance you are not sure what to do or where to have dinner Sean will have plenty of good choices. We are looking forward to booking here again in the future.

review_text:
Title: A Perfectly Decorated Detroit Gem in an Ideal Location
Rating: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ (5/5 stars)
We had the pleasure of staying at this incredible townhouse in Detroit, and I cannot recommend it enough. The impeccable decor showcased Detroit's unique artifacts and history.
The attention to detail in the design was remarkable. Curated with locally sourced items that embodied the spirit of Detroit. From vintage photographs and artwork to industrial-inspired furniture, every corner exuded both charm and authenticity.
The location of the townhouse was ideal. Exploring the nearby restaurants, cafes, and shops was great and we walked to a
rock concert.
The townhouse itself was clean, well-maintained, and equipped with all the amenities for a comfortable stay. The host's thoughtfulness and prompt communication enhanced the experience. They were incredibly helpful, ensuring that our stay was nothing short of perfect.

He had Motown records on surround sound for us to use, stocked fridge with things for us to try included in the rental price for the night along with a GC for the coffee shop right up the block for the morning we left, which was AMAZING coffee at Cafe Alto. The Airbnb was also RIGHT next door to second best bar which was such a fun atmosphere. It was walking distance to ford field which made our night much easier and more relaxed. The area was safe. Sean was extremely responsive and so helpful with getting there, getting in, and getting around the area. The place was like staying in a hotel when it came to cleanliness and details to everything.
HIGHLY RECOMMEND to everyone. I have already had friends book since our stay cause I couldn’t say enough good things.
I will and cannot wait to be back again! 😊

Food, drinks, toiletries, fine linens, upscale appliances - you name it, this place has it. It’s the perfect space for a one night stay, but I easily could have stayed there for a few days I felt so at home. The cherry on top was definitely the host for me though! Sean is the BEST! Timely communication, helpful recommendations on places around the area, and just plain making sure you have everything you need to have a nice stay. There was no detail skipped, and it showed. I will definitely be staying here again!

review_text:
64 Watson is crème de la crème when it comes to an Airbnb experience. The second we walked in we were greeted by a note and local wine, beer and booze to enjoy. Some times during our stay we opted to relax to have happy hour at home vs venturing out to one of the many bars or restaurants nearby.
The shower and bathroom had substantial hot water and plenty of toiletries if you forgot your own.
The bed was extremely comfy and the closet had tons of space to unpack and feel comfortable.
If you do not like a well lit bedroom I would make sure you bring an eye mask, as it doesn’t get super dark and night and the sun definitely shines in early. But, this is just a note for someone like myself who is sensitive, otherwise the place was perfect and wouldn’t hesitate to book again on my next venture to Detroit!

review_text:
Best Airbnb experience ever! I rented Sean's condo for a weekend in Detroit, and the entire experience--from the communication and check-in instructions to the location and decor--was absolutely five+ star in every respect.
The condo itself is absolutely beautiful and oozes Motown chic. The furnishings are stylish, comfy, and the perfect complement for a stay in the Motor City. And even with a changeover on the day I arrived, the condo was completely spotless and fully stocked, going well beyond any stay I've had, hotel or Airbnb!
Similarly, no hotel can match the concierge service that Sean provides. Sean's tips and recommendations give you the sense that you're visiting the best spots in Detroit, some that even the locals have yet to discover!
And the condo is in an absolutely prime location. In one day I was able to visit several local coffee shops, shop at uniquely Detroit stores, eat amazing ethnic food, and take in a Pistons game, all within walking distance!

When I arrived, I was blown away by the attention to detail and personal touches throughout the space. The host left a lovely handwritten note, provided a welcome gift, and the fridge was fully stocked. All the decor in the condo is inviting and makes you feel at home. Throughout the space, the owners have spared no expense in providing luxury amenities and treat for you to enjoy. It is a lovely and quiet retreat in the heart of the city. I can not say enough great things about my visit. If you're ever visiting Detroit, don't waste your time looking at other options, this is the place to book!

The place looked exactly like the photos and was immaculate. The towels were fresh and fluffy. The bed was the perfect firmness with lots of pillows. The neighborhood was safe - we parked in the lot right next to the building. Sean was great with arranging our parking.
He thought of everything, which makes you feel like you are at home at his condo.
Don’t second guess, this is the place to stay in Detroit! You will be in for a treat staying at this condo!

The condo is warmly and comfortably decorated with tastes of Detroit (there were literal ones, too!), very well maintained, and ideally located in the Brush Park district of Midtown for experiencing the city’s culture, history and renaissance.
Restaurants (highly regard Grey Ghost is across the street; make a reservation!), shops, the arts and all three major sports venues are short walks away. The Woodward Avenue Q-Line streetcar, MoGo shared bikes and various scooter brands are nearby transit options.
Communication with Sean, including during the reservation and try processes, was extremely simple. We’ll take advantage of this fantastic property again.

Sean was INCREDIBLY helpful and accommodating and quick to respond. He left us a gift card for a local coffee shop, lots of drinks and snacks, and the online guidebook was very helpful!
Absolute top-notch customer service, and made for a very restful staycation for my husband and I.
Not to mention- the house is gorgeous, comfortable, quiet and spotless. Tons of natural light, comfortable bed, and all the amenities you’ll need (from local brands, too!). If you’re staying in Detroit, this is the perfect place! We will be back here as soon as we can!

name: Dayna
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
January 2022
,
·
Stayed about a week
review_text:
My husband and I had an amazing experience staying at Sean's condo. I travel a lot, and this was by far one of the best airbnb's that I have ever stayed at.
When I was looking for a location and sent Sean a question, he responded immediately and was super helpful and patient in answering my questions and explaining the area. Parking was a concern for me, and he not only reassured me of ample parking but also contacted the owner of the lot next door to the condo to confirm pricing and availability. I booked immediately and he arranged the parking.
Upon arrival the place looked exactly like the photos - super impressive! There was a beautiful welcome display for us including a gift card to a local coffee shop, detroit themed face masks, candles and a hand written note.
We stayed for over a week, so having ample space was important. We felt at home at Sean's condo. The furniture was comfortable, the place was super clean and the modern bathroom was amazing. The building was quiet and easy to access, yet secure. We felt very safe - I even walked the neighborhood a few times.
We walked to several local dining places. Sean supplied a welcome guide that included some places for us to try - another special addition. The restaurants were amazing and we were only a few blocks away from Whole Foods. In between meals, we enjoyed the Detroit themed snacks and beverages Sean made available. The home was stocked with waters, faygo pop, better made potato chips, spirits from a local Detroit distillery, and much more. There was even a Detroit style pizza for us. The Detroit themed décor was phenomenal. The condo could be featured in home and garden - modern yet hints of traditional and contemporary styles combined.
Sean went the extra mile to make our holiday special in Detroit. Additionally, he checked in with us and was super responsive. We will definitely book again!
This is the places to stay in Detroit!!!

review_text:
The stay for the home was very convenient for what we were doing in Detroit. We were able to be in a quiet location, low traffic, but a quick drive to any activities we wanted to do.
The aesthetic of the home was beautiful. It was a minimalistic statement.
Some things that did not impress me about the stay.
It was great that there was off street parking, but the gate would not stay open unless you were holding it open. If you are traveling alone, the gate would swing closed and damage your car. The gate was also held closed by a broken bike lock cord. Very cheap looking.
They should really invest in a keyless entry. The key was difficult to turn to unlock, and actually hurt to use.
Overall, a great experience for my needs.

Many parts of Corktown are under construction, so you'll see some fences, construction equipment, and dust, but we didn't mind it. If you have a car, it is about a 5 to 15 min drive to Mexicantown, Downtown, and Midtown, respectively. So you're well situated to visit different parts of Detroit. The check-in process was straightforward, and the WiFi worked well. All and all, I would highly recommend staying here if you're visiting Detroit.

·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The house on Marantette Street in Corktown is in a great location near many good restaurants and centrally located. Michelle and Becky have thought of everything a traveler could need, from kitchen ware to bathroom amenities. Everything was cozy and comfortable. The check-in instructions were extremely clear and easy to follow, as were the checkout instructions.
It is rather close to the sidewalk, as we learned when we got there, so if you need privacy you’ll definitely want to keep the drapes closed. The neighborhood is probably best described as “transformational,” as it’s a mix of beautiful older homes that are well-maintained, crisp contemporary new builds, remodeled/updated homes like this one, and some pretty neglected homes, as well.
We did have an issue related to unexpected construction going on right in front of the house for the duration of our stay, but Michelle & Becky took care of us and more than made up for the inconvenience.
We will definitely come back for another visit in the spring!

name: Nathaniel
rating_info:
Rating, 3 stars
,
·
October 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This place is the definition of a dichotomy! For every great thing there are weird things, quirky things, about this house. For instance- easy, private, secure parking (plus!) but no toilet paper rolls in the bathrooms (weird); on sight laundry (great!), no door to the master bathroom (letting it all hang out while doing your business is quirky); great location and easy Uber ride to downtown (amazing!); bathroom mirror is inside the cabinet (scavenger hunt- odd!); Quiet neighborhood (excellent!); Giant painting in the living room of what we could only figure out was of a dead woman in a red dress (Halloween cool, but... still creepy). The bedrooms are big, but they're in what seems to be an old attic with very angled ceilings- not so great for tall people- so expect to duck and weave as you get out of bed.
All in all, the location is the thing here. If you need great/central access to Detroit, and a kitchen and laundry, this is your spot. If you're uneasy about nonstandard stairs, bathrooms, bedrooms, or a painting of a dead woman in the living room, you'll probably want to find another spot.
This place feels like it's not yet finished, as if someone said, "Yeah, this is good enough." I suppose that's the review- good enough!
Next time we're in town we'll probably stay somewhere else- variety being the spice of life and all.

We also enjoyed the Corktown neighborhood. We walked over to nearby Ima where we had a great meal. This house was a great base for exploring Detroit. Being able to park on the property was a bonus. I would stay here again if I could when in Detroit again!

We wrapped up our vacation in the heart of Detroit at Beckey and Michelle’s artistic and comfortable home in Corktown. Lots of character and a wonderful book collection. We were a short drive to Greektown, Tiger stadium and the newly revitalized riverfront.

Location was great for a quick drive to local restaurants and activities without being in the hustle and bustle of the city. Taco the cat is so cute and friendly! One thing to keep in mind are the stairs walking up to the unit (there are quite a few and a little steep). Sharing mostly because we stayed here with our 4 month old and had to be extra careful walking up and down. Would definitely recommend this space if you’re planning a visit to Detroit. :)

review_text:
My partner and I had a really enjoyable stay at Zac & Renee’s. The apartment was clean and exactly like the pictures describe.
They were also very proactive and kind. When we needed an appliance fixed, Zac & Renee were very responsive, with Zac even coming over to personally address and resolve the issue.
Couple small things to note: the bedroom is a super open space but it doesn’t have a door. This wasn’t a big issue, but something I didn’t realize before. Also, the tv is located in the corner of the bedroom/study and is on the smaller side — so there really isn’t an entertainment system set up if you plan to watch tv.
Overall, we enjoyed this space (and how much sun there was in the apartment!) and would definitely recommend it to anyone coming to the D!

CONS: There are a lot of stairs to get into the apartment as it is the entire upstairs of a large, renovated house. This was not an issue for us in any way, just something to consider if mobility is difficult for you or anyone in your travel party. The shower was a bit small for my husband, who is 6'3", but it was totally manageable.

name: Jason
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
May 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
A beautifully decorated, spacious apartment in midtown Detroit! Plenty of space for dining in in the open floor plan living/dining area, or head out to a myriad of top notch restaurants within walking distance or a short drive. We went to dinner at Shewolf for delicious handmade pasta and Italian food , and Bakersfield for tacos and drinks. Close walk away from a perfect little coffee shop, The Roost (on Canfield), for breakfast coffee, pastries, and gourmet treats.
The house is beautiful, with plenty of space to hang out in comfort, all basics are provided for. Kitchen has necessities for anyone wanting to stay in and cook, coffee maker, coffee, toaster, blender, microwave, Brita water filter container in refrigerator all provided along with a selection of spices & cabinet accoutrements available. Bathroom has toiletries if you find you’ve forgotten something as often happens. Stacked washer and dryer in bathroom. Neighborhood is very peaceful, great for strolling and admiring the unique houses, (I admit a preference for the original structures over the brand new ones coming up) and quiet at night.
Most importantly, there is Taco the cat! We went half of our stay without seeing or hearing a peep out of him, despite randomly calling for him upon entering the foyer each time; he was probably avoiding us. Judging by the large “#whereistaco?” written on the hallway chalkboard by a previous guest, this is not unusual. Then on the second day, we heard a low, scratchy meow in response, and out of the cat door he emerged to take our measure and receive pets. Don’t stand up too quickly until he gets used to you, or he’ll bolt. He’s exceedingly charming and willing to roll over for tummy rubs, with zero hand chomps like my own cat gives. Word of warning, he tends to drool with happiness when pleased with your petting, so don’t be startled. When he’s done, he heads back inside his door. He adds to the already copious charm of a lovely place to visit and makes it feel more like home.

Response time was amazing as well when I couldn’t locate toilet paper . Only difficulty I had was locating the garbage bins outside when leaving at 4am due to the darkness between the house and the neighboring home, I hope I placed the trash in the correct garbage bins (I’m so sorry if I didn’t). But overall if you’re visiting Detroit this place is a gem! You won’t regret it.

review_text:
This home is airy and spacious and PERFECT. Hard to believe it was so much more affordable than a hotel (which, for our purposes, would've been farther anyway!) AND so much nicer. The hosts were kind enough to let us stay later to catch our late afternoon flight. Everything was just a mile or two away, and since great restaurants will deliver. The neighborhood was quiet and beautiful.
If you like delicious Italian food, you MUST go to SheWolf which is just a short walk away. So divine we went twice. Also on our list was my fave Detroit spot: Two James Distillery in Corktown. It's the first licensed distillery since the Prohibition. We did a tasting tour and loved every minute.
Thank you, Zac & Renee (and Taco who we finally met just before we left)!

rating_info:

,

August 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: I live in Detroit and I managed to snag this place kind of last minute (the week before) for a solo staycation. It was so nice that I barely wanted to leave once the weekend was up. The spot is biking distance to everything that I wanted to get to: the Alpha House, the BLKOUT Walls Mural festival, Yum Village, and Motor City Wine. Though I had planned to eat out, I just kept grabbing takeout and bringing it back to the apartment because it was *that* nice that I just wanted to hang out there. So much has already been noted in the previous reviews, so I'll mention that all of the light switches are labeled (ex. hallway, fans, pantry, etc). That attention to detail demonstrates that the hosts are incredibly thoughtful. My one suggestion is if you plan to nap during the day and you like it dark, bring a sleep eye mask. The bedroom curtains are sheers. This isn't a complaint, just a little info, because it's all so lovely and sun-filled!

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Spacious space with a nice sized bedroom/workspace. We did a gal's trip and appreciated being able to retreat to our own little house vs. staying in an apartment building. The neighborhood was off the beaten path, which is what we were looking for during the 4th of July weekend. Location was close enough to walk to some spots in Midtown, neighbors were super friendly, and we never felt unsafe (though we both lived in Brooklyn for many years, so if you're coming from other areas you might feel different). When we wanted to explore a bit further, we'd get an Uber/Lyft and it was usually around $10/ride. From/to the airport was bout $30 each way. Had we been more prepared, we would've brought our helmets and rented some bikes, which would have made exploring even more fun. Hosts were communicative, space was clean, easy check-in!
